Name: attrelid
Description: The table this column\n belongs to

Name: atttypid
Description: The data type of this\n column

Name: attdispersion
Description: attdispersion is the dispersion\n statistic of the column (0.0 to 1.0), or zero if the statistic has not been calculated, or -1.0 if VACUUM found that the column contains no duplicate entries (in which case the dispersion should be taken as 1.0/numberOfRows for the current table size). The -1.0 hack is useful because the number of rows may be updated more often than attdispersion is. We assume that the column will retain its no-duplicate-entry property.

Name: attlen
Description: This is a copy of the\n pg_type.typlen for this column's type.

Name: attnum
Description: The number of the column.\n Ordinary columns are numbered from 1 up. System columns, such as oid, have (arbitrary) negative numbers.

Name: attnelems
Description: Number of dimensions, if\n the column is an array

Name: attcacheoff
Description: Always -1 in storage, but\n when loaded into a tuple descriptor in memory this may be updated cache the offset of the attribute within the tuple.

Name: atttypmod
Description: atttypmod records type-specific data\n supplied at table creation time (for example, the maximum length of a varchar column). It is passed to type-specific input and output functions as the third argument. The value will generally be -1 for types that do not need typmod.

Name: attbyval
Description: A copy of pg_type.typbyval of this column's type

Name: attstorage
Description: A copy of pg_type.typstorage of this column's type

Name: attisset
Description: If true, this attribute is\n a set. In that case, what is really stored in the attribute is the OID of a tuple in the pg_proc catalog. The pg_proc tuple contains the query string that defines this set - i.e., the query to run to get the set. So the atttypid (see above) refers to the type returned by this query, but the actual length of this attribute is the length (size) of an oid. --- At least this is the theory. All this is probably quite broken these days.

Name: attalign
Description: A copy of pg_type.typalign of this column's type

Name: attnotnull
Description: This represents a NOT NULL\n constraint. It is possible to change this field to enable or disable the constraint.

Name: atthasdef
Description: This column has a default\n value, in which case there will be a corresponding entry in the pg_attrdef catalog that actually defines the value.
